fields.name: Harper Lee
fields.biography: American novelist widely known for To Kill a Mockingbird.

fields.name: George Orwell
fields.biography: English novelist and essayist, famous for 1984 and Animal Farm.

fields.name: Stephen Hawking
fields.biography: Renowned theoretical physicist and author of A Brief History of Time.

fields.name: Yuval Noah Harari
fields.biography: Israeli historian and author of Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind.

fields.name: Anne Frank
fields.biography: Jewish diarist who wrote The Diary of a Young Girl during World War II.

fields.name: Nelson Mandela
fields.biography: Anti-apartheid revolutionary and former President of South Africa.

fields.name: Stephen R. Covey
fields.biography: Author of The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People.

fields.name: Jane Austen
fields.biography: English novelist known for Pride and Prejudice and Sense and Sensibility.

fields.name: Richard Dawkins
fields.biography: British evolutionary biologist and author of The Selfish Gene.

fields.name: Jared Diamond
fields.biography: American geographer and author of Guns, Germs, and Steel.

fields.name: Walter Isaacson
fields.biography: American writer, journalist, and biographer of Steve Jobs.

fields.name: Dale Carnegie
fields.biography: American writer and lecturer, author of How to Win Friends and Influence People.

fields.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
fields.biography: American novelist, widely known for The Great Gatsby.

fields.name: Charles Darwin
fields.biography: English naturalist and geologist, author of The Origin of Species.

fields.name: David McCullough
fields.biography: American author and historian, wrote The Wright Brothers.
